snippet: Nothing would do more to clean up politics in New York than healthy, hard-fought elections.
abstract: Editorial notes that wave of scandals involving New York State politicians has prompted slew of proposals to clear out New York's political swamp, with Gov Andrew Cuomo saying he is preparing a list of reforms; asserts that of all proposed reforms, most critical is to open up elections so that voters have real choices.
lead_paragraph: Nothing would do more to clean up politics in New York than healthy, hard-fought elections.

headline.seo: What Reform in Albany Will Require
